title: Ambush in Burkina Faso kills 51 soldiers
description: The ambush took place on Friday in the Oudalan province near the restive frontier with Mali and Burkina Faso.

title: Biotech industry hit by sudden investment drought
description: As global economic uncertainty, rising interest rates and inflation take their toll on the sector, companies are seeing their valuations fall on the stock market.

title: Lula visits disaster zone after Brazil floods kill 36
description: Rescue workers were rushing to find survivors on Monday.

title: France, a land of immigration since the 19th century
description: France is a far more multicultural society than many people usually think.

title: New 6.4-magnitude earthquake hits southern Turkey
description: The shock was recorded in the country's southern province of Hatay and follows the February 6 devastating earthquake in Turkey and Syria which killed more than 44,000.

title: Spain rail chair resigns after botched train order
description: Renfe's president, Isaias Taboas, stepped down following an order for commuter trains that were too wide to fit through some tunnels.

title: Volodymyr Zelensky's Russian years
description: 'The five lives of Volodymyr Zelensky' (2/5). Before his presidency, Zelensky became known in the world of comedy and television at the turn of the millennium. He lived in Moscow, where he established links with the country that he is now at war with.

title: US engages in strategy to remove Wagner Group from Africa
description: Washington made an offer to the Central African Republic to train its army and increase humanitarian aid, in exchange for the expulsion of the Russian paramilitaries.

title: Israelis rally against judicial reform bill ahead of vote
description: They say the controversial overhaul, which changes the way judges are picked, threatens democracy and thousands came to Jerusalem to protest near parliament.

title: Leiji Matsumoto, the Japanese creator of Captain Harlock, has died
description: World star of Japanese comics, the artist had managed to revive his career by collaborating with the music group Daft Punk. He died on February 13, aged 85.

title: Behind the masks: The 'bate-bolas' of the Rio Carnival
description: The exuberant clowns known as 'ball beaters' are preparing to take over the streets of Rio's Black, working-class neighborhoods for the Carnival, which starts on February 21.

title: Turkey still counting its dead after February 6 quake
description: At least 44,000 died in the earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria on February 6, but many keep looking for their loved ones.

title: This year's Berlinale raises the question of putting down roots
description: Several films at the festival, on in Berlin until February 26, deal with the issues around establishing a sense of home, especially for those being pulled in different directions.

title: French finance minister pushes for $16 billion IMF Ukraine aid program
description: Bruno Le Maire spoke after the International Monetary Fund found an agreement with Ukraine over a loan, on Friday.

title: Moroccan singer Saad Lamjarred's Paris rape trial begins
description: The pop singer is charged with aggravated rape and assault at a Paris hotel in 2016.

title: Algeria releases mother of wanted opponent who fled to France
description: The morther of activist Amira Bouraoui had been arreested after Bouraoui espaced extradition from Tunisia and found refuge in France.

title: Salman Rushdie attacks Roald Dahl rewrites as 'absurd censorship'
description: The novelist, who survived a near-fatal attack last year because of his own writing, led condemnations of changes to texts by the famed children's author.

title: Paris to hire thousands to get city transport ready for Olympics
description: RATP, the capital's regional transit authority, said that it was embarking on a major recruitment drive so that the city would be prepared for the extra demand of the Olympics and the Rugby World Cup.

title: The controversial think tank behind Israel's justice system reform
description: The Kohelet Policy Forum, funded by American libertarians, has come under heavy criticism for inspiring the Netanyahu government's plan to severely limit the powers of the Supreme Court.

title: French pension reform: The damage of a flawed project
description: After two weeks of chaotic debate in the Assemblée Nationale, a democratic malaise is emerging. If the government still hopes to pass its reform, it must erase the most unfair aspects of the project.

title: At Munich conference, Ukraine's allies show will to restart ammunition production
description: China's top diplomat Wang Yi also announced that his country would propose a peace plan for Ukraine on the first anniversary of the conflict on February 24.

title: Biden makes surprise first visit to Ukraine, promises new arms supplies
description: US President Joe Biden, who was scheduled to visit Poland this week, made his first visit to Kyiv since the start of the war.

title: Pakistan's dollar shortage threatens to bring key industries to a halt
description: While Islamabad is doing whatever it can to unlock an IMF rescue package, industrialists are calling for an end to the blockade of imports, fearing the paralysis of entire sectors of the economy.

title: 'Improving older workers' skills is the French pension reform's major missing piece'
description: Economist Patrick Artus writes that better qualified employees, not a later retirement age, would increase France's employment rate.

title: Djibouti announces construction of first spaceport in Africa
description: The continent, which is ideally located around the equator, is experiencing a strong space craze. Space is now seen as a crucial tool for development and sovereignty.

title: New York Met allows 3D copies of 16th-century sculptures for French castle
description: The New York Metropolitan Museum of Art has allowed France to make 3D copies of sculptures it acquired in 1907, which will be installed in the castle where the originals long resided.

title: Violence at the Stade de France: Panel split over UEFA responsibility
description: Two members of the independent panel who authored the report on the fiasco of the May 2022 Champions League final have distanced themselves from one of its conclusions.

title: French army operation in Burkina Faso officially over
description: The West African nation announced that the French military had officially withdrawn its military presence from the country.

title: Wendy Sherman, US deputy secretary of state: US and Europe 'rely on each other'
description: As US President Joe Biden prepares to visit Poland, the State Department's number two speaks of the country's support for Ukraine.

title: Bangladesh government shuts down opposition newspaper
description: The Dainik Dinkal was closed after a last-ditch appeal was rejected. The move is stoking fears about press freedom in the country.

title: Belgium launches an emergency plan to combat drug trafficking
description: In response to the increase in drug trafficking and violence in Antwerp, the Belgium government has appointed a national drugs commissioner and is doubling the number of port police.

title: Biochar: A promising energy source and carbon sink to help combat climate change
description: Obtained through pyrolysis from biomass residues, vegetable charcoal is a simple solution for removing CO2 from the atmosphere, without negative consequences.

title: For young Ukrainians in France, 'studying is a second chance to return to a normal life, despite the war'
description: Since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, more than 2,000 displaced Ukrainian students have come to France. French universities reacted quickly, welcoming the flow of students and drawing on lessons learned during the Afghan and Syrian conflicts.

title: 'There is a way to move toward more humane prisons in France: prison regulation'
description: Faced with inhumanely overcrowded prisons, a mechanism was proposed to encourage the release of prisoners nearing the end of their sentences. It was rejected in January by justice minister, Eric Dupond-Moretti.

title: 'Without real support, the revolt in Iran is running out of steam'
description: With Arab states refusing to act out of fear and Western countries' symbolic sanctions having little effect, the Iranian protest is weakening.
